Based on the search results, I found information about documentaries, films, and video content related to Gabriel García Márquez and "One Hundred Years of Solitude." Here's what I discovered:

## Documentary About Gabriel García Márquez

The documentary "GABO: THE CREATION OF GABRIEL GARCIA MARQUEZ" features interviews with former Colombian president Cesar Gaviria, writers Juan Gabriel Vasquez and Plinio Apuleyo Mendoza, journalists, New Yorker correspondent Jon Lee Anderson, biographer Gerald Martin, and includes appearances by former President Bill Clinton.

This documentary "recounts the life of the author of One Hundred Years of Solitude from birth in the humble village of Aracataca, in northern Colombia, through his passion for writing, family life, time in the political battles the 1970s and 1980s, and crowning as winner of the 1982 Nobel Prize for Literature".

## Netflix Adaptation (2024)

Netflix has released a Colombian television series based on Gabriel García Márquez's 1967 novel, with the first eight episodes released on December 11, 2024. Directors Alex García López and Laura Mora have adapted the Nobel laureate's novel into a sixteen-part Netflix series.

Before his death in 2014, García Márquez had refused to sell the rights to the novel as he did not believe the time constraints of a feature film were sufficient for a proper adaptation.

## Behind-the-Scenes Content

There are cinematographer interviews available about how directors of photography Paulo Perez and María Sarasvati Herrera brought García Márquez's 1967 novel to Netflix.

Netflix's "One Hundred Years of Solitude" is not the first screen adaptation of Garcia Marquez's works, indicating there have been previous film adaptations of his other novels.

## Educational Content

TED Conferences released a cartoon format talk titled "Why Should You Read One Hundred Years of Solitude?" which attracted over a quarter of a million views and is available in twenty-one languages, reproducing the myth about García Márquez's epiphany on the road to Acapulco.

The search results show there is significant video content available about García Márquez and his masterwork, including biographical documentaries, the recent Netflix adaptation, behind-the-scenes material, and educational content that explores both the author's life and his literary legacy.
